"We could make another Averron." Rhett chuckles. "Y'know, under this one. Or anything else, assuming we're the first to find it."

You recall what Ayla said: that the offering was waiting for her when her and the other alliance leaders paved the way into what's now Averron City. "How many Celestial Gems do you think it took to make Averron? They aren't just going to leave that lying around, are they?"

"Hell, I'd first ask for a rocket launcher or somethin'." Vision chuckles. "Seems more useful than another city right under ours."

"So you're not planning on splitting the loot?" Nel asks.

"Fine, fine." Vision responds. "A rocket launcher for each of us."

There's a rumbling from overhead; you see a worm-like shape in the fog, wriggling its way into a distant cave wall.

"Crawlers." Nel says, assuming a fighting stance.

"Mm?" Rhett says. "I haven't seen one of those yet."

"Well, I think they see us, which means we're on a clock. I don't think they're special, but anything can go. Light on your feet, or they'll ambush from below."
